text: {{Infobox writer | name = Terry Teachout | image = Terry teachout 2013.jpg | caption = Terry Teachout in 2013 | birth_name = | birth_date = | birth_place = Cape Girardeau, Missouri, U.S. | death_date = | death_place = Smithtown, New York, U.S. | occupation = | ethnicity = | citizenship = | education = St. John's College William Jewell College University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign | alma_mater = | period = | genre = Criticism | subject = | movement = | notableworks = | spouse = | partner = | children = | relatives = | awards = | signature = | signature_alt = | module = | website = }} Terry Teachout (February 6, 1956 â€“ January 13, 2022) was an American author, critic, biographer, playwright, stage director, and podcast host. He was the drama critic of The Wall Street Journal and Commentary. He also wrote for The New York Times and National Review. He was a co-host on Three on the Aisle, a monthly podcast which ran from September 2017 to December 2021. Teachout died in his sleep on January 13, 2022 in Smithtown, New York just less than a month before his 66th birthday. ==References== Category:1956 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Podcasters Category:American critics Category:American playwrights Category:American theatre directors Category:American columnists Category:Writers from Missouri Category:Writers from New York City Category:People from Cape Girardeau, Missouri Category:Theatre critics
title: Terry Teachout
